contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox airport | name = Zavitinsk | nativename = | nativename-a = | nativename-r = | image = | image-width = | caption = | IATA = | ICAO = | type = Military | owner = | operator = [[Russian Air Force]] | city-served = | location = Zavitinsk | elevation-f = 906 | elevation-m = 276 | coordinates = {{Coord|50|11|30|N|129|30|12|E|type:airport|display=inline,title}} | website = | metric-elev = | metric-rwy = | r1-number = | r1-length-f = 9842 | r1-length-m = 3000 | r1-surface = [[Concrete]] | stat-year = | stat1-header = | stat1-data = | stat2-header = | stat2-data = | footnotes = }} '''Zavitinsk''' is an air base in [[Amur Oblast]], [[Russia]] located 9 km northeast of [[Zavitinsk]]. It was a major nuclear bomber base of the [[Long Range Aviation]] (a sister of [[Ukrainka]]). A revetment area exists on the far side of runway with 18 large stands. It began operating the [[Tupolev Tu-16]] aircraft late in the 1960s, serving a close/medium range facility as opposed to its long-range sister base Ukrainka. Units stationed at Zavitinsk included: * '''303 TBAP''' (303rd Heavy Bomber Aviation Regiment) flying [[Tupolev Tu-16|Tu-16s]] beginning in 1955 and upgrading to [[Tupolev Tu-16#Variants|Tu-16Ks]] in 1972, and [[Tupolev Tu-22|Tu-22Ks]] around the 1980s.<ref name=DA>{{cite web| title = Dal'nyaya Aviatsiya | publisher = Aviabaza KPOI | url = http://airbase.ru/squad/russia/da/ }}</ref> The 303rd was formed 1941 as the 303rd Long-Range Bomber Aviation Regiment. In 1946 it was renamed the 303rd Bomber Aviation Regiment, and in 1951 renamed 303rd Heavy Bomber Aviation Regiment. Disbanded 1994.<ref>Holm, http://www.ww2.dk/new/air%20force/regiment/bap/303tbap.htm</ref> ==References== <references/> [[Category:Soviet Long Range Aviation bases]] [[Category:Soviet Frontal Aviation]] [[Category:Russian Air Force bases]] [[Category:Airports in Amur Oblast]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Amur Oblast]] {{Russia-mil-stub}}
